<small>Also see: **<big>[[H0459|אִלֵּין]]</big>**</small>

 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דְּנָה‎</span><sub>57</sub> **demonstrative prounoun common** ==this== (Zinjirli <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎זן‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎זנה‎</span>; Egyptian Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎זנה‎</span> ([[BDB#S-C|S-C]]<sup> Pap. B 17</sup> +); <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎זנך‎</span> (ib.<sup>C 6, D 8</sup>); Nabataean, Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דנה‎</span> ([[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>264</sup> [[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>26</sup>); [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דֵּין‎</span> (e.g. [[1Sam.10.27|1Sam 10:27]]) and (with <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הָ‎</span>, i.e. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הָא‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***ecce***) <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הָדֵתן‎</span>; Aramaic of Têma <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הא זא‎</span> ([[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>195. 198</sup>); Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> (contracted for <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הָֽדְנָא‎</span>); Mandean <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎האזין‎</span>; Sabean <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ([[BDB#Hom|Hom]]<sup>Chrest. 13</sup>); Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> all from [<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דֶּה‎</span>,] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎זה‎</span>, + demonstrative ***noun*** ([[BDB#W|W]]<sup>CG 108 f.</sup>); feminine Biblical Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דָּא‎</span>, [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דָּא‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הָדה‎</span>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Mandean <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎האזא‎</span>, Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> without the ***n***; the plural is  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אִלֵּין‎</span>, q. v. ); — ***this:*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** [[Dan.2.18|Dan 2:18]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎רָזָא דְנָה‎</span> ***this*** secret, v[[Dan.2.28|Dan 2:28]] v[[Dan.2.29|Dan 2:29]] v[[Dan.2.30|Dan 2:30]] +, [[Ezra.4.11|Ezra 4:11]]; [[Ezra.5.3|Ezra 5:3]]; [[Ezra.5.4|Ezra 5:4]]; [[Ezra.5.9|Ezra 5:9]] +; <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כָּלדְּֿנָה‎</span> [[Dan.5.22|Dan 5:22]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אַחֲרֵי דְנָה‎</span> ***after this*** [[Dan.2.29|Dan 2:29]]; [[Dan.2.45|Dan 2:45]] so <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בָּאתַר דְּנָה‎</span> [[Dan.7.6|Dan 7:6]]; [[Dan.7.7|Dan 7:7]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כִּדְנָה‎</span> ***like this, thus***, [[Jer.10.10|Jer 10:10]] (= Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כֹּה‎</span>), [[Dan.2.10|Dan 2:10]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִלְּתָא כִדְנָה‎</span> a word ***like this*** (compare <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כָּזֹאת‎</span> [[Esth.4.14|Esth 4:14]]), [[Esth.3.29|Esth 3:29]]; [[Ezra.5.7|Ezra 5:7]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎עַלדְּֿנָה‎</span> ***on account of this*** [[Dan.3.16|Dan 3:16]]; [[Ezra.4.22|Ezra 4:22]]; [[Ezra.5.5|Ezra 5:5]]; [[Ezra.5.17|Ezra 5:17]]; [[Ezra.6.11|Ezra 6:11]] as conjunction = ***therefore*** (compare Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלזֹֿאת‎</span>) [[Ezra.4.14|Ezra 4:14]]; [[Ezra.4.15|Ezra 4:15]]. — See also <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קֳבֵלַ‎</span> and <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎קַדְמָה‎</span>.
